Detailed Description

CxPtrArr array of void pointers

Plugin replacement for the MFC CPtrArray.

Additional Functions implemented:

  • Find,
  • AddUnique,
  • RemoveValue,
  • ...
Extensive use of the macro ASSERT(magic == PTRARR_MAGIC); for sanity checks.
The DEBUG version ASSERTS on some out of bound conditions, the Release version checks for overflow, and in that case it does a NOOP

Member Function Documentation

int CxPtrArr::AddUniq ( const void *  ptr  ) 

Add a pointer only if it is unique.

Adds new entry if it is unique. (aka not in the array already) Searches from the end, assuming LIFO (last in first out)

int CxPtrArr::Find ( const void *  ptr  ) 

Find the first pointer that matches ptr.

Find existing (stored) pointer, return index to it if found. Return -1 if not found

void CxPtrArr::FreeExtra (  ) 

Free extra allocated space.

Shrink to desired size

Frees any extra memory that was allocated while the array was grown. This function has no effect on the size or upper bound of the array.

int CxPtrArr::GetSize (  )  const [inline]

Returns the size of the array.

Since indexes are zero-based, the size is 1 greater than the largest index

int CxPtrArr::GetUpperBound (  )  const [inline]

Return the index of the upper bound (zero-based).

Returns the current upper bound of this array. Because array indexes are zero-based, this function returns a value 1 less than GetSize.
The condition GetUpperBound( ) = -1 indicates that the array contains no elements.

void CxPtrArr::RemoveAll (  )  [inline]

Removes all data from the array.

Removes all the pointers from this array but does not actually delete what is behind the pointers. If the array is already empty, the function still works. The RemoveAll function frees all memory used for pointer storage.

void CxPtrArr::RemoveValue ( void *  ptr  ) 

Remove pointer by value.

Will not continue after the first item is removed. (aka: will not delete a duplicate item)
Optimized to start from the end, as it assumes most likely scenario of last in - first out)

void CxPtrArr::SetSize ( int  nNewSize,
int  nGrowBy = -1 
)

Set New Size, Expand if neccessary.

Set Size of array grow if needed.

Grows/Truncates the array as needed
Return type: void

Parameters:
nNewSize Arg Type: int
nGrowBy Arg Type: int optional argument
